intro: Trigonostemon lawianus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
